title: Lava Maze runite mine

properties.name: description
properties.value: Located north-west of the Lava Maze in level 46 Wilderness, the Lava Maze Runite Mine is the only mining site in free-to-play worlds with runite ore to be mined. Therefore, the runite ore is rarely left spawned, as rune miners often time the spawns and wait for the ore to spawn in anticipation. The mine is located north of both the Bandit Camp Mine and the Lava Maze in the Wilderness. There are two rocks here which contain runite ore. Although the area around the rune rocks is crawling with aggressive deadly red spiders, players will rarely be attacked by the spiders when standing next to the runite. World switching is useful here to fill the inventory with ore, as it takes around 12 minutes for the runite to respawn.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Lava Maze runite mining siteThe RuneScape Classic Wiki also has an article on: classicrsw:Wilderness runite mine
Lava Maze runite mine
Released13 August 2001 (Update)
Also calledWilderness Rune Rocks, 46 Wilderness Mine
MembersNo
LocationNorth-west of the Lava Maze
Map
Advanced data
Typemine

Located north-west of the Lava Maze in level 46 Wilderness, the Lava Maze Runite Mine is the only mining site in free-to-play worlds with runite ore to be mined. Therefore, the runite ore is rarely left spawned, as rune miners often time the spawns and wait for the ore to spawn in anticipation. The mine is located north of both the Bandit Camp Mine and the Lava Maze in the Wilderness. There are two rocks here which contain runite ore. Although the area around the rune rocks is crawling with aggressive deadly red spiders, players will rarely be attacked by the spiders when standing next to the runite. World switching is useful here to fill the inventory with ore, as it takes around 12 minutes for the runite to respawn.

Player killers are often found around this mine, as foes cannot teleport until they reach a Wilderness Obelisk, the Mage Arena, or level 20-30 Wilderness. To complement this, it is easy to attack and kill unsuspecting players who are looking for runite ore to mine as they often forego armour in order to reduce weight and item loss upon death. To reduce the risk of being killed while mining, it is recommended that players bring a few pieces of high-healing food, such as sharks.

Contents

  • 1 Rocks
  • 2 Getting there and banking
    • 2.1 From Edgeville (members)
    • 2.2 Canoeing from the Grand Exchange/Varrock (free players)
    • 2.3 Running on foot (free players)
    • 2.4 P2P banking
    • 2.5 F2P banking

Rocks[edit | edit source]

Rock MiningQuantity
LevelExp
Runite851252

Getting there and banking[edit | edit source]

From Edgeville (members)[edit | edit source]

  1. Pull the lever south of Edgeville's bank to enter the Deserted Keep.
  2. Slash the spider web, exit out, and head south and then east among the fence until you reach an opening.
  3. Go through the gate's opening, and head west past the giant spiders.
  4. Afterwards, the mine is a bit to the south, but make sure you don't go past the deadly red spiders on the west side.

Canoeing from the Grand Exchange/Varrock (free players)[edit | edit source]

  1. Near the west wall of the Grand Exchange, build a waka canoe, which requires 57 Woodcutting and an axe (preferably a bronze or iron axe).
  2. Upon arrival at the moss giants, run north-west to the Lava Maze, and stay along the northern face of the maze.
  3. You'll run directly into the mine, but make sure you don't go past the deadly red spiders on the west side.

Running on foot (free players)[edit | edit source]

  1. Between Varrock and Edgeville, follow the River Lum to its end by the Mage of Zamorak at Southern Wilderness Mine.
  2. Run directly north until you bump into the Lava Maze after passing several aggressive monsters including skeletons and moss giants.
  3. Go a bit east around the Lava Maze to the north side.
  4. Stay along the northern face of the maze.
  5. You'll run directly into the mine, but make sure you don't go past the deadly red spiders on the west side.

P2P banking[edit | edit source]

  1. Go inside the King Black Dragon Lair just to the west of the Lava Maze down the ladder in the caged lesser demons' area.
  2. Pull the lever to teleport into King Black Dragon Lair.
  3. Activate your teleport and as soon as you hit the ground, and you'll be safe from player killers, but beware of the King Black Dragon himself.
  4. Bank at Edgeville via an Amulet of glory, or in Varrock.

F2P banking[edit | edit source]

  1. Run to the west side of the mine past the deadly red spiders.
  2. Either go directly south until you reach level 20 Wilderness activating your Varrock teleport and as soon as you arrive, or continue running south all the way to Edgeville.
  3. Bank at your destination.

Located north-west of the [[Lava Maze]] in level 46 [[Wilderness]], the '''Lava Maze Runite Mine''' is the only [[mining site]] in [[free-to-play]] worlds with [[runite ore]] to be [[Mining|mined]]. Therefore, the runite ore is rarely left [[spawn]]ed, as rune miners often time the spawns and wait for the ore to spawn in anticipation. The mine is located north of both the [[Bandit Camp Mine]] and the Lava Maze in the Wilderness. There are two rocks here which contain runite ore. Although the area around the rune rocks is crawling with [[aggressiveness|aggressive]] [[deadly red spider]]s, players will rarely be attacked by the spiders when standing next to the runite. [[World switching]] is useful here to fill the inventory with ore, as it takes around 12 minutes for the runite to respawn.

[[Player killing|Player killers]] are often found around this mine, as foes cannot teleport until they reach a [[Wilderness Obelisk]], the [[Mage Arena]], or level 20-30 Wilderness. To complement this, it is easy to attack and kill unsuspecting players who are looking for runite ore to mine as they often forego [[armour]] in order to reduce weight and [[Items Kept on Death|item loss upon death]]. To reduce the risk of being killed while mining, it is recommended that players bring a few pieces of high-healing [[food]], such as [[shark]]s.

==Getting there and banking==

===From Edgeville (members)===
#Pull the lever south of [[Edgeville]]'s [[bank]] to enter the [[Deserted Keep]].
#Slash the spider web, exit out, and head south and then east among the fence until you reach an opening.
#Go through the gate's opening, and head west past the [[giant spiders]].
#Afterwards, the mine is a bit to the south, but make sure you don't go past the [[deadly red spider]]s on the west side.

===Canoeing from the Grand Exchange/Varrock (free players)===
#Near the west wall of the [[Grand Exchange]], build a waka [[canoe]], which requires 57 [[Woodcutting]] and an [[axe]] (preferably a [[bronze axe|bronze]] or [[iron axe]]).
#Upon arrival at the [[moss giant]]s, run north-west to the [[Lava Maze]], and stay along the northern face of the maze.
#You'll run directly into the mine, but make sure you don't go past the [[deadly red spider]]s on the west side.

===Running on foot (free players)===
#Between [[Varrock]] and [[Edgeville]], follow the [[River Lum]] to its end by the [[Mage of Zamorak]] at [[Southern Wilderness Mine]].
#Run directly north until you bump into the [[Lava Maze]] after passing several [[aggressive]] [[monsters]] including [[skeleton]]s and [[moss giant]]s.
#Go a bit east around the Lava Maze to the north side.
#Stay along the northern face of the maze.
#You'll run directly into the mine, but make sure you don't go past the [[deadly red spider]]s on the west side.

===P2P banking===
#Go inside the [[King Black Dragon Lair]] just to the west of the [[Lava Maze]] down the ladder in the caged [[lesser demon]]s' area.
#Pull the lever to teleport into King Black Dragon Lair.
#Activate your teleport and as soon as you hit the ground, and you'll be safe from [[player killer]]s, but beware of the [[King Black Dragon]] himself.
#Bank at [[Edgeville]] via an [[Amulet of glory]], or in [[Varrock]].

===F2P banking===
#Run to the west side of the mine past the [[deadly red spider]]s.
#Either go directly south until you reach level 20 [[Wilderness]] activating your [[Varrock teleport]] and as soon as you arrive, or continue running south all the way to [[Edgeville]].
#Bank at your destination.
